title: What to Do When Steam Says "Content File Locked"

steps.title: This allows Steam to access settings that were previously blocked.
steps.content: This allows Steam to access settings that were previously blocked. If you're on Windows, right-click the program icon and select Run as administrator . For Mac users, you'll need to be logged into the computer as an administrator .

steps.title: Services meant to protect your computer might be blocking Steam.
steps.content: Services meant to protect your computer might be blocking Steam. Anti-virus software, VPNs, P2P Clients and File Sharing software, Firewalls, and security applications are installed on your computer to prevent fraudulent or malicious activity, but these can also prevent your Steam client from accessing the servers and your computer. Check if any of them are preventing Steam from downloading data to your computer, then turn it off or allow Steam to continue working to solve the "disk write error" issue. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Any corrupted files in the game will prompt the error message.
steps.content: Any corrupted files in the game will prompt the error message. Go to your Steam library and right-click the game you're getting the error with. Click Properties > Installed Files > Verify integrity of game files . This process will take a few minutes and any corrupted or missing files will automatically be replaced. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Stored data can be corrupted and cause errors.
steps.content: Stored data can be corrupted and cause errors. Your stored data includes data from the games in your library as well as updates. However, if this data is corrupted, Steam won't be able to access it and will give you an error. Follow these steps to clear your cached data: Go to Settings (Windows) or Preferences (Mac) in Steam. Go to Downloads and click Clear Download Cache . [3] X Research source

steps.title: If this connection is having trouble, you'll see errors in Steam.
steps.content: If this connection is having trouble, you'll see errors in Steam. Fix the connection to get rid of the Steam "Content File Locked" error by following these steps: Open Command Prompt as administrator. Type netsh winsock reset and press Enter . See if the error is gone from Steam.

steps.title: A fresh install may do the trick for you.
steps.content: A fresh install may do the trick for you. If you're using Windows, press Win + I and click Apps to find and uninstall Steam. On Mac, drag and drop the Steam icon from the Applications folder in Finder to the trash. Once you've deleted the app, you can re-install it by going to https://store.steampowered.com/about/ .
